benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Add tags to bundle

covered: POST: Valid payload scenarios create Tag objects and persist them (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC07).
POST: Invalid payload and request body handling (malformed JSON TC10, non-array TC11, missing body TC14, invalid/extra fields TC12 TC15, missing required header TC13, header/body validation TC18).
POST: Authorization handling (unauthorized access returns 401 TC16).
POST: Server error handling and timeouts (service unavailable 503 TC17, timeout 504 TC22).
POST: Large payloads and performance considerations (maximum payload TC20, payload too large TC21, performance TC24 TC25).
POST: Duplicate handling and idempotency considerations (duplicate tags scenario TC26).
POST: Integration checks (TC27 verifies via GET after POST; TC28 cross-service data consistency).
POST: Persistence checks (tags persisted on bundle per TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC07).
gaps: Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling or burst request handling.
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).
Authorization edge case: No test for 403 Forbidden due to insufficient permissions (only 401 covered).
Internal server error coverage: No explicit 500 scenario tested (only 503/504).
Idempotency edge-case: No explicit test ensuring repeated identical POSTs don’t create duplicates beyond TC26.
recommendations: Add rate-limiting tests and caching header validations to cover non-functional requirements.
Add 403 Forbidden scenario for insufficient permissions to complement 401.
Add explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario to test full server-side failure handling.
Add an explicit idempotency test for repeated identical POST requests to verify no duplicates are created.
Extend header validations (beyond X-Killbill-CreatedBy) and header input sanitization tests.
Consider stress/concurrency tests with higher load beyond TC25 to validate robustness under extreme conditions.
